title: Figma Buzz Gets Three Major Updates to Streamline Brand Asset Creation

paragraphs.content: Figma has unveiled three significant features for its Buzz collaboration tool designed to empower marketing and brand teams to create on-brand assets more efficiently. The updates introduce **configurable templates built on design systems**, **direct video trimming**, and **plugin integrations** for tools like digital asset management and animation platforms. These features address common workflow friction points by keeping designers and marketers within Figma rather than forcing them to switch between multiple applications. According to Figma, the updates represent an initial step toward establishing Buzz as a unified workspace where creative teams can produce cohesive, high-impact branded content at scale.

paragraphs.content: The three-feature rollout follows months of customer feedback requesting deeper customization and workflow control within Buzz. Templates can now be built using component properties and variable modes, allowing marketers to toggle between brand variations—such as colors, campaigns, and markets—without navigating through hundreds of template options. Video trimming eliminates the need for external editing tools, while plugin support connects popular platforms including Brandfolder, Lokalise, and LottieFiles directly to Figma. Together, these capabilities aim to reduce context-switching and accelerate the creation of social media posts, digital ads, and event promotion materials.

sections.title: Component Properties and Variable Modes: Making Templates Flexible Without Sacrificing Brand Control

paragraphs.content: Marketing templates in Buzz now leverage **component properties**, enabling brand designers to create flexible, reusable templates that automatically adapt to different platforms without requiring separate versions. The "Change layout" panel allows marketers to adjust layouts, colors, logos, and calls to action while maintaining brand guidelines, reducing the manual work traditionally required to customize assets. Templates built with Variable modes publish seamlessly to Buzz and display a Variable switcher in the menu, giving teams simple access to toggle between different brand modes. This approach significantly reduces the complexity of managing template libraries that previously required hundreds of individual variations.

paragraphs.content: Organization and Enterprise admins now have the ability to disable "From Figma" Community templates in Buzz, ensuring teams use only brand-approved options and maintaining stricter control over asset quality. The batch-creation feature allows users to add all templates within a template set in a single click, accelerating campaign launches and reducing repetitive setup tasks. By connecting templates directly to design systems, Figma ensures that brand designers can copy templates created in Figma Design and paste them into Buzz, where component properties automatically function without additional configuration.

sections.title: Video Trimming and Plugin Integrations: Consolidating Workflows in a Single Canvas

paragraphs.content: Video trimming functionality now allows users to **edit videos directly within Figma Buzz without toggling to external applications**, addressing a critical workflow bottleneck. This capability provides fine-grained control over video playback and duration, making it simpler to create video collages for event webpages, animated backgrounds for Instagram ads, or short-form social media clips. The feature eliminates the need to synchronize multiple video durations across different platforms, a task that previously required jumping between Figma and separate video editing tools. Product Designer Natasha Tenggoro prototyped the feature using Figma Make to ensure video playback would be intuitive for various use cases, demonstrating Figma's focus on user experience details.

paragraphs.content: Plugin support now extends to digital asset management (DAM), translation management systems (TMS), and animation tools, allowing teams to access brand-approved images, pull translations, and animate assets without leaving the Figma canvas. Motion design plugins enable teams to add animations to headlines, insert eye-catching visuals, or mimic on-screen interactions directly within Buzz. Teams can also create and publish internal plugins for their organization or share them with the broader Figma Community, fostering deeper workflow integration tailored to specific business needs.
